532 Gallery Jaeckel
DANIELLE RIEDE:
Earth Gem, 2025
Oil on porous matte gesso, wood frame
101.6 × 76.2 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$4300
Shipping quote on request. Local pickup available.
About the artwork:

This installation-like painting evokes a crystalline gem from recycled materials, drawing on Riede’s dance-movement records to suggest geological strata and rebirth, like a phoenix emerging from earth’s layers. Framed dimensions: 104.6 × 79.2 × 4 cm.

About the artist:

Danielle Riede’s practice deconstructs painting traditions through site-specific installations using recycled materials, exploring themes of time, nature, and ephemerality. Her works, such as the “Ocean Womb” series, evoke geodes, glaciers, and biological forms, blending storytelling with visual and audio elements to inspire empathy for terrestrial and aquatic realms.

Riede was born in 1976 in Grand Junction, Colorado, and was raised in the US and Iceland. She received her BFA from the University of Virginia and her MFA in Painting from Virginia Commonwealth University, and studied with Daniel Buren at the Kunstakademie Düsseldorf.

Riede has had solo exhibitions including “Venus Walks on Pearls” at Künstlerloge, Ratingen, Germany. She has participated in recent group exhibitions in Mexico City, Athens, Berlin, and New York, with works in international museum collections.
